Representing organic molecules

Given the following structural formula:

  1. Give the condensed structural formula for the compound.

    INSTRUCTIONS:
    • Show what is bonded to carbon atoms in the following order: hydrogen atoms, functional groups (including halogen substituents), branched groups.
    • Include brackets around any hydroxyl group, or branched group.
    • Do not combine any CH2CH2 groups. For example, the condensed structural formula for butane is CH3𝐂𝐇2𝐂𝐇2CH3CH3CH2CH2CH3.
    Answer:

    The condensed structural formula is:

    one-of
    type(chemcompound)

  2. Here is the structural formula again:

    Give the molecular formula for the compound.

    Answer:

    The molecular formula is:

    chemcompound

2-methylpropane is a gas used in refrigerators.

  1. To which homologous series does 2-methylpropane belong?

    Answer:

    2-methylpropane is a/an .

  2. Write down the structural formula of a structural isomer of 2-methylpropane and answer the questions that follow.

    INSTRUCTIONS:
    • If your isomer is an ester, write your answer so that the side chain (the part that comes from the alcohol) is on the right.
    • If your isomer is a carboxylic acid, write your answer with carbon number 11 on the right.
    • Show what is bonded to carbon atoms in the following order: hydrogen atoms, any functional groups, any halogen substituents, and then any branched groups.
    • Include brackets around any functional groups as well as any branched groups.
    • Do not combine any CH2 groups. For example, the condensed structural formula for butane is CH3𝐂𝐇2𝐂𝐇2CH3CH3CH2CH2CH3.
    Answer:
    1. The condensed structural formula of an isomer is: .
    2. The IUPAC name of the isomer is: .
    3. The isomer is a isomer of 2-methylpropane.
    one-of
    type(chemcompound)

Alkanes as fossil fuels

Hydrocarbon cracking is an important industrial process that is often combined with fractional distillation to form fuels and other products.

  1. Which of the following reaction equations correctly shows the process of hydrocarbon cracking?

    A C4H10+H2→2C2H6C4H10+H2→2C2H6
    B C2H4+H2→C2H6C2H4+H2→C2H6
    C C20H42→C8H18+C3H6+C9H18C20H42→C8H18+C3H6+C9H18
    Answer:

  2. It is possible to separate the products of hydrocarbon cracking and obtain specific products from a crude oil mix through a process called fractional distillation. This is done using a fractionating column. Crude oil evaporates when heated to 700°C700°C. The gas bubbles through a tray that is kept at a certain temperature. The alkanes and alkenes that condense at that temperature will then condense in the tray.

    A fractionating column consists of several of these trays at different temperatures arranged from hot at the bottom to cool at the top.

    Which of the following reasons best explains why chemists are able to fractionally distill various compounds by using different temperatures?

    A This process can only work for alkanes since these compounds just happen to follow a trend in boiling points
    B Every compound has a unique boiling point and chemists use this to separate the compounds.
    C The more carbon atoms in the chain, the greater the intermolecular forces and therefore the higher the boiling point. That means that these molecules will condense at higher temperatures.
    Answer:

  3. The diagram below shows a fractional distillation column.

    You are also given the following chain lengths and uses

    Use Chain length
    liquid petroleum gas C1 - C4
    naphtha C5 - C7
    petrol C10 - C16
    paraffin and jet fuel C10 - C16
    diesel fuel C20 - C70
    wax C20 - C50
    fuel oil C20 - C70
    bitumen C70

    Which letter on the diagram represents where liquid petroleum gas is distilled off?

    Answer:

What organic compound is it?

You have an unknown organic compound and are trying to determine which compound it is. So far all you know is that it is a straight chain organic compound with no branched groups.

  1. After performing more investigations you find that this compound is a saturated hydrocarbon. This compound is unreactive and is a very important fuel source. This allows you to determine the homologous series of the unknown compound.

    What is the name of the homologous series with that functional group?

    Answer:

    The homologous series is:

  2. To determine how many carbon atoms are contained in the longest chain you note the following boiling points for all the compounds in the same homologous series.

    NOTE: If the homologous series is the esters then this list gives the chain length for the carboxylic acid part. The alcohol part of the ester is always methyl.
    Chain length Boiling point (°C°C)
    11−162−162
    22−89−89
    33 −42−42
    44 00
    55 3636
    66 68,568,5
    77 98,4298,42
    88 125,5125,5

    You find that the boiling point of the unknown compound is −89°C−89°C.

    How many carbon atoms are contained in the longest carbon chain?

    Answer:

  3. You have now determined the functional group of the compound and how many carbon atoms are in the longest carbon chain.

    You also know that if the compound has a functional group and the compound is not an ester, an aldehyde or a carboxylic acid, the functional group is attached to carbon number 22.

    What is the IUPAC name of the compound?

    Answer:
    one-of
    type(string.nocase)
